Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Scarab
Description: Very good quality scarab with depictions of all anatomical details. However, the two registers on the flat surface are carved more crudely: two floral symbols intertwined with nefer (''good, beautiful, perfect'') and wadj (''green'') signs, symmetrically opposed.
